chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

∑ n f = fold_right m u (map f (list_an 0 n))

Premises:
list_an = fix list_an (a n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => a :: list_an (S a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments list_an (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
fold_right : forall A B : Type, (B -> A -> A) -> A -> list B -> A
map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> list A -> list B
map_ext_in_iff : map ?f ?l = map ?g ?l < -> (forall a : ?A, In a ?l -> ?f a = ?g a) where ?A : [X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X n : nat f : nat -> X |- Type] ?B : [X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X n : nat f : nat -> X |- Type] ?f : [X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X n : nat f : nat -> X |- ?A -> ?B] ?g : [X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X n : nat f : nat -> X |- ?A -> ?B] ?l : [X : Type m : X -> X -> X u : X n : nat f : nat -> X |- list ?A]
list_fun_inv : forall (X : Type) (l : list X), X -> {f : nat -> X | l = map f (list_an 0 (length l))}
map_app_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ n -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ m = map f l /\ n = map f r}}
Forall_forall_map : forall (X : Type) (f : nat -> X) (n : nat) (l : list X) (P : X -> Prop), l = map f (list_an 0 n) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> P (f i)) < -> Forall P l
list_repeat : forall X : Type, X -> nat -> list X
map_middle_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m : list Y) (y : Y) (n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ y :: n -> {l : list X & {x : X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ map f l = m /\ f x = y /\ map f r = n}}}
map_cons_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (y : Y) (m : list Y), map f ll = y :: m -> {x : X & {l : list X | ll = x :: l /\ f x = y /\ map f l = m}}
map_duplicate_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (l' : list Y) (y1 : Y) (m' : list Y) (y2 : Y) (r' : list Y), map f ll = l' ++ y1 :: m' ++ y2 :: r' -> {l : list X & {x1 : X & {m : list X & {x2 : X & {r : list X | l' = map f l /\ y1 = f x1 /\ m' = map f m /\ y2 = f x2 /\ r' = map f r /\ ll = l ++ x1 :: m ++ x2 :: r}}}}}
list_injective_map : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X), (forall x y : X, f x = f y -> x = y) -> list_injective ll -> list_injective (map f ll)
list_assoc : forall X Y : Type, eqdec X -> X -> list (X * Y) -> option Y
Forall_map : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (P : Y -> Prop) (ll : list X), Forall P (map f ll) < -> Forall (fun x : X => P (f x)) ll
flat_map_single : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (l : list X), flat_map (fun x : X => f x :: nil) l = map f l
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
list_injective : forall X : Type, list X -> Prop
Init.Nat.max = fix max (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S n' => match m with | 0 => n | S m' => S (max n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.max (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope

list_max = fun l : list nat => fold_right Init.Nat.max 0 l : list nat -> nat Arguments list_max _%list_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
Permutation.nat_bijection_Permutation : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), FinFun.bFun n f -> FinFun.Injective f -> let l := seq 0 n in map f l ~p l
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
map_list_repeat : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (x : X) (n : nat), map f (list_repeat x n) = list_repeat (f x) n
Nat.eqf = fun f g : nat -> bool => forall n : nat, f n = g n : (nat -> bool) -> (nat -> bool) -> Prop Arguments Nat.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
FinFun.bFun = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x : nat, x < n -> f x < n : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bFun _%nat_scope _%function_scope
